bibl.title: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Frederick F. Russell, March 15, 1926

div1.p: [Laura Carter] thanks Russell for the news clipping on Moran and Kissinger. She writes that she will resume work on the book.

div1.head: Letter from [Laura Armistead Carter] to Frederick F. Russell, March 15, 1926
div1.opener:
////////////
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
March 15, 1926.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
Thank you ever so much for your letter of March 12th., received
this morning, in re crab hold breeding. You've been so beautifully
thoughtful in remembering my interest in “news from the front” in the
yellow fever work! And it has meant a lot to me.

No, I haven't seen the February 20th. number of the Journal of
the A. M. A. with Hanson's article, but I shall to-morrow when I am
going over to Baltimore. For this information also I am much your
debtor.

My health is decidedly better, and I am “continuing to pay
some attention to it.” I think that I can safely resume work on the
book in the near future and am looking forward to doing so with the
nearest approach to happiness I've had since we stopped.

With very best remembrances to yourself and all other friends at
headquarters.
div1.closer:
Sincerely and gratefully yours, from the N. Y. World in re
Thank you also for the clipping for
the Reed Board: Moran and Kissinger. It was very interesting.
